column1: '''''The Banbury Advertiser'' 19 December 1956''' is an issue of ''The Banbury Advertiser''
column2: published on [[19 December]] [[1956]]. Included in the article "Deddington’s New Library Opened by Mrs. L. Hichens – Prof. Tolkien’s Whimsical Talk" (page 5) are quotes from [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s speech held at the opening of the new Deddington Library on [[14 December]] [[1956]] (slightly different from the quotes appearing in the [[Oxford Mail 15 December 1956|''Oxford Mail'' 15 December 1956]]).<ref name=Ded>"[http://www.deddingtonnews.co.uk/__data/assets/pdf_file/0016/8080/Tolkien.pdf Deddington Library
column5: [http://www.deddingtonnews.co.uk/ DeddingtonNews.co.uk] (accessed 23 December 2011)</ref><ref>{{webcite|author=[[Morgan Thomsen]]|articleurl=http://mythoi.tolkienindex.net/#post5|articlename=Professor Tolkien's Whimsical Talk|dated=30 April 2012|website=[http://mythoi.tolkienindex.net/ Mythoi]|accessed=30 April 2012}}</ref>

column1: Nowadays books are besieged by a great many powerful embattled enemies, some of whom have been strongly entrenched, and to be here at the opening of a strong point from which troops can be sent out against those enemies is a great honour.

The wealth of books to be found here is food for the mind, and everyone knows that for the stomach to go without food for a long time is bad, but for the mind to go without food is even worse.<ref name=Ded/>
